info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 2:38PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN RIO ARRIBA AND NORTHWESTERN SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM MDT... At 237 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Santa Clara Pueblo, or near Espanola. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Espanola, Santa Clara Pueblo, Cuartelez, Sombrillo, Santa Cruz, San Ildefonso Pueblo, El Rancho and La Puebla. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
